intro: Atropanthe sinensis, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its leaves are lanceolate and have a hairy texture, while its stems are often hairy as well. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators like bees and butterflies.
